intro: Moquilea megalophylla, commonly known as the giant fern, is a striking species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is characterized by its large, feathery fronds that can reach lengths of up to three meters. The plant belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are composed of numerous pinnae, which are arranged in a delicate, lace-like pattern. Moquilea megalophylla plays an important ecological role by providing habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
